patient_sex_quote: From July 1995 to August 2007, 18 patients (9 males) with irreversibly high pulmonary vascular resistance
diagnostic_method_quote: Heterotopic heart transplantation (HHT), with anastomosis of the donor pulmonary artery to the recipient right atrium
treatment_quote: Heterotopic heart transplantation (HHT), with anastomosis of the donor pulmonary artery to the recipient right atrium
comorbidities: ['restrictive cardiomyopathy', 'idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy', 'ischemic cardiomyopathy', 'anthracycline chemotherapy', 'severe left ventricular dysfunction after resection of a sub-aortic membrane', 'corrected transposition of great arteries with right isomerism', 'ventricular septal defect']
comorbidities_quote: The etiologic indication for HHT was restrictive cardiomyopathy in 8, idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy in 3, and ischemic cardiomyopathy in 2. In addition, 1 patient each presented with cardiomyopathy arising after anthracycline chemotherapy; severe left ventricular dysfunction after resection of a sub-aortic membrane, corrected transposition of great arteries with right isomerism; ventricular septal defect
filename: Luvison et al. - 2013 - Pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules are of donor origin in lung allografts.pdf

presenting_symptoms_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer was diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest during inpatient admission for COVID-19 infection
diagnostic_method: ['CT angiogram chest', 'bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL)', 'transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules']
diagnostic_method_quote: The patient was diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest during inpatient admission for COVID-19 infection...the patient eventually underwent bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules
imaging_findings: ['diffuse pulmonary nodules', 'numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance']
imaging_findings_quote: A follow-up CT scan chest 1 year later showed numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
immunohistochemistry_quote: The patient's case was discussed with a multidisciplinary ILD clinic, and given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules, a decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans
outcome_quote: A decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans
comorbidities: ['ductal hyperplasia of the breast', 'common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID)', 'asthma', 'obstructive sleep apnea', 'thyroid follicular cancer']
comorbidities_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer
